title: Chuck Berry's Revolution

buildup.text: His guitar intro to Johnny B. Goode became the most copied riff in history.

discovery.text: Berry fused blues guitar with teenage lyrics about cars, school, and girls.

twist.text: John Lennon said if you tried to give rock another name, you'd call it Chuck Berry.

climax.text: His duck walk and showmanship created the template for every rock performer after.

punchline.text: Before there was a King, there was Chuck.

quiz.question: What did Chuck Berry contribute to rock and roll?
options: He fused blues guitar with teenage lyrics and invented rock's language
